intro: Cremastus pulcher, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by the wind.
